result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER in court.  Attorney Curtis Paul Julka in court for ISAIHA A VESPER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Julka states the defendant will be waiving his right to a prelim. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Julka acknowledges receipt of the information, confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint, and waives any reading. Atty Julka enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:01 AM
Return date scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Curtis Paul Julka in court for ISAIHA A VESPER. Atty Julka requests a status hearing as he just got appointed and is still waiting for discovery. Court sets status for October 25, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
Status hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
(Atty Curtis Julka)
Status hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER appeared by video.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states that he has Atty Julka as an attorney. Court questions Atty Julka - states he may take the case. Court informs both Atty Julka and the defendant to contact the PD's office.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

Defendant phoned and said he has no ride to court today. He said that he is getting an attorney, but the attorney will not be appearing today. Defendant was given zoom instructions as this was a status of counsel hearing.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court sets for Status of Counsel on June 7, 2022 at 2:00 PM

Warrant canceled - spoke to Rhonda from dispatch.

1:02 PM Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Court questions defendant on address. Court informs defendant he needs to complete processing and sign his bond. Statement by the defendant. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Statement by defendant regarding bond. Court reinstate previous bond and conditions. Court instructs defendant on his attorney rights and how to obtain counsel. Court schedules status hearing May 24, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:06 PM.
Status hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(please see e-post it) I called the def back to set up a court date to quash his warrant. Def stated he had concerns about getting picked up on his other active warrant in Fond Du Lac County. Def was given a court date of May 3, 2022 at 1:00 PM and was told this was a mandatory in person appearance.
Sent to GLSO on April 5, 2022.

1:06 PM Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER not in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. This was scheduled for a mandatory in person court appearance. Court orders a warrant for the defendant - forthwith. 

Court adjourned at 1:08 PM
Status hearing on April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:16 PM Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER appeared by video.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court - informs the defendant that he needs to sign the bond and complete processing. Defendant confirms, his ride fell thru today and is requesting an attorney. Defendant has not applied to the PD's office. Court sets for Status Hearing April 4, 2022 at 1:00 PM mandatory appearance to sign bond and complete processing.

Court adjourned at 3:18 PM

Defendant called Clerk of Courts and stated his ride to court for 3:15 p.m. today fell through, due to vehicle breakdown, and requested to appear via telephone. Defendant was made aware that this is a mandatory appearance and processing needs to be completed and bond needs to be signed. Zoom instructions were given by phone. Defendant will try to find another ride to court.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 23, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant is to take all medication as prescribed as by a doctor.

1:36 PM Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER appeared by telephone, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Statement by def regarding bond. Court sets bond at $2,500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to take all medication as prescribed as by a doctor.  

Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim March 23, 2022 at 3:15 PM. Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 1:41 PM.

Defendant called regarding court today, had a ride and his ride cancelled and is requesting to appear via zoom. Address on file is correct and phone number has been updated. Zoom instructions have been provided.
Warrant Canceled - Spoke to Rhonda from Dispatch
Warrant Canceled - Spoke to Rhonda from Dispatch
Letter from Fond du lac County Department of Community Programs dated 02/24/2022 re: defendant
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant phoned regarding the warrant on this case and requested a court date to get it taken care of. He stated that he has been in inpatient treatment and that is why he forgot about the missed initial appearance date. He is being released and can appear as early as Monday, February 28th. Initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022. I told the defendant that I would mail a notice but he may not get it in time. Defendant stated that the address on file is correct, he is being released shortly and he will be back residing there. Defendant was asked to have something faxed to our office regarding the fact that he has been in treatment, if possible.
Sent to GLSO on Feb 16, 2022.
Defendant called regarding court today, has a ride but his ride cancelled and defendant is requesting to appear via zoom. Zoom instructions provided.

9:30 AM Defendant ISAIHA A VESPER not in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin and County of Green Lake. Court calls 22CF18, 22TR38 and 22TR39. Nobody in court or on zoom. Court enters default judgments on the TR cases for the amount on the citations. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. Court issues a warrant for the criminal case forthwith. 

Court adjourned at 9:32 AM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
